questions.text: Original: 'Had the committee not intervened decisively, the entire project would have collapsed irreversibly.'
options: Without the committee's decisive intervention, the project would have suffered irreversible collapse.
The committee's intervention was decisive, so the project collapsed irreversibly.
If the committee had intervened decisively, the project would not have collapsed.
The committee intervened decisively after the project had already collapsed irreversibly.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה תנאי היפותטי עם היפוך (inversion) - 'Had the committee not...' שמציין תנאי עבר לא מתקיים. המשמעות: הוועדה כן התערבה בצורה נחרצת, ולכן הפרויקט לא קרס. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את אותה משמעות באמצעות 'Without...' שמציינת את אותו תנאי היפותטי. שאר האפשרויות משנות את המשמעות - אפשרות 2 טוענת שהפרויקט קרס למרות ההתערבות, אפשרות 3 הופכת את כיוון התנאי, ואפשרות 4 מציגת רצף זמנים שגוי.
examples: Had she not studied hard, she would have failed → Without her hard studying, she would have failed
Had they not arrived early, they would have missed the show → Without their early arrival, they would have missed the show
questions.grammarRule: Third conditional with inversion: 'Had + subject + not + past participle' = 'If + subject + had not + past participle'. Can be restated using 'Without + noun phrase'
questions.commonMistakes: Confusing the actual outcome with the hypothetical condition, or misunderstanding that 'had not' with inversion describes an unreal past condition
questions.usageTip: When you see 'Had + subject + not...' remember it describes something that DID happen, preventing a negative outcome

questions.text: Original: 'Scarcely had the new regulations been implemented when complaints began pouring in from various stakeholders.'
options: The new regulations were barely implemented before various stakeholders started complaining heavily.
After the new regulations were fully implemented, complaints gradually increased from stakeholders.
Various stakeholders complained before the new regulations could be properly implemented.
The implementation of new regulations was delayed due to complaints from various stakeholders.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Scarcely had... when...' שמציין שני אירועים שקרו כמעט בו-זמנית, כאשר האירוע השני קרה מיד לאחר הראשון. כלומר, התקנות יושמו וכמעט מיד החלו התלונות. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המשמעות עם 'barely... before' שמציינת את אותו רצף זמנים מהיר. אפשרות 2 מציעה תהליך הדרגתי (לא מיידי), אפשרות 3 הופכת את סדר האירועים, ואפשרות 4 טוענת שההטמעה נדחתה בגלל התלונות, מה שסותר את המקור.
examples: Scarcely had he left when it started raining → He had barely left before it started raining
Hardly had we arrived when the show began → We had hardly arrived before the show began
questions.grammarRule: 'Scarcely/Hardly had + subject + past participle + when...' indicates two events happening in very quick succession. Can be restated with 'barely/hardly + past perfect + before'
questions.commonMistakes: Thinking 'scarcely had...when' means the second event prevented the first, or misunderstanding the immediate timing relationship
questions.usageTip: Remember that 'scarcely/hardly had...when' shows immediate sequence - the second event happens almost instantly after the first

questions.text: Original: 'Not until the investigation was thoroughly completed did the authorities realize the full extent of the corruption.'
options: Only after the investigation was thoroughly completed did the authorities realize the full extent of the corruption.
The authorities realized the full extent of corruption before the investigation was completed.
During the thorough investigation, the authorities gradually realized the extent of corruption.
The investigation was completed thoroughly because the authorities realized the extent of corruption.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Not until...' עם היפוך (inversion), שמדגיש שהרשויות הבינו את היקף השחיתות רק לאחר שהחקירה הושלמה במלואה - לא לפני כן. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המשמעות עם 'Only after...' שמציינת את אותו רצף זמנים ואת ההדגשה שההבנה הגיעה רק בסיום החקירה. אפשרות 2 הופכת את סדר האירועים, אפשרות 3 מציעה תהליך הדרגתי במהלך החקירה (לא בסיומה), ואפשרות 4 הופכת את יחס הסיבה-תוצאה.
examples: Not until midnight did she finish her work → Only after midnight did she finish her work
Not until he apologized did she forgive him → Only after he apologized did she forgive him
questions.grammarRule: 'Not until + time/event + auxiliary + subject + main verb' emphasizes that something happened only after a specific point. Can be restated with 'Only after/when + normal word order'
questions.commonMistakes: Forgetting that 'not until' emphasizes the timing - the action happened only after the specified point, not before or during
questions.usageTip: When you see 'Not until...' with inversion, focus on the timing emphasis - the main action occurred only after the specified condition was met
